page.title: 05The Ecology of Gt.Coxwell
page.content: Gt.Coxwell and the surrounding area are lucky to have several footpaths and bridleways.There is also Badbury Clump,which is a National Trust picnic area and is used by local people to exercise their dogs.It is a good area for plants,birds and mammals,many of which are common to sandy soil & marshy ground,(Eye-bright,Enchanters Nightshade,Black Poplar etc).There is a carpet of Bluebells in late spring. The whole area,like so many others,has been ravaged by Dutch Elm Disease and many old stately elms have had to be felled.The National Trust has replant- ed with oak,maple etc.Many field flow- ers have been lost through intensive crop spraying & ploughing up to the hedges.The only cowslips now found are in the churchyard,which has become a small nature reserve.
